messages.message: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

source:
import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card'; import { Badge } from '@/components/ui/badge'; interface RealTimeMetrics { totalCalls: number; activeCalls: number; completedCalls: number; urgentCalls: number; avgDuration: number; successRate: number; } interface PerformanceMetricsProps { realTimeMetrics: RealTimeMetrics; calls: any[]; } export const PerformanceMetrics = ({ realTimeMetrics, calls }: PerformanceMetricsProps) => { return (
M√©triques de Performance

Indicateurs en temps r√©el

Taux de r√©ponse {realTimeMetrics.successRate}%
Appels urgents (P1) {realTimeMetrics.urgentCalls}
Temps moyen de r√©solution {realTimeMetrics.avgDuration}min
Appels actifs maintenant {realTimeMetrics.activeCalls}
R√©partition par Statut

Distribution des appels par √©tat

Termin√©s
{realTimeMetrics.completedCalls}
En cours
{realTimeMetrics.activeCalls}
En attente
{calls?.filter(c => c.status === 'pending')?.length || 0}
); };

suppressedMessages.message: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.
